content.title: Vascularized Lymph Node Transfer (VLNT)
content.definition: A microsurgical procedure where lymph nodes with their vascular pedicle are harvested from a donor site and transplanted to the affected limb to restore lymphatic drainage in patients with lymphedema.

theories: Lymphangiogenesis: VEGF-C from transplanted nodes stimulates new lymphatic growth
Pumping function: Transferred nodes act as lymphatic pump
Bridging: New lymphatic connections form between recipient tissues and transferred nodes
mechanism.venous_role: Transferred nodes drain into recipient site veins

ideal_candidates: Moderate to advanced lymphedema (ISL Stage II-III)
LVA not suitable due to lack of functional vessels

relative: Poor venous drainage at recipient site

groin_superficial_inguinal.reverse_lymphatic_mapping: Essential to identify and preserve leg-draining nodes

submental.advantages: No risk of lower limb lymphedema, hidden scar

lateral_thoracic.advantages: Can combine with latissimus flap for breast reconstruction
lateral_thoracic.risks: Potential breast cancer recurrence surveillance concerns

omentum.advantages: Large lymphoid tissue mass, laparoscopic harvest

supraclavicular.risks: Proximity to brachial plexus, thoracic duct

key_principles: Perform reverse lymphatic mapping for groin donor
Identify and protect sentinel lymph nodes draining extremity

recipient_preparation.vessel_selection: Recipient artery and vein for anastomosis

technique.inset: Position nodes within subcutaneous tissue near lymphatic territories

outcomes.long_term: Benefits may continue to improve over 1-2 years

codes.cpt: 38999 | Unlisted procedure, hemic or lymphatic system

clinical_pearls: VLNT = best for advanced lymphedema or failed LVA
Reverse lymphatic mapping prevents donor site lymphedema
Submental nodes = no risk of limb lymphedema
Benefits may take 6-12 months to manifest fully
Can combine with LVA for comprehensive approach
learning_objectives: Understand mechanism of vascularized lymph node transfer
Know donor site options and their risks/benefits
Compare VLNT with LVA for patient selection
Recognize importance of reverse lymphatic mapping
board_review_points: Donor sites: groin (SCIA), submental, lateral thoracic, omentum
Reverse mapping prevents donor site lymphedema
LVA = early disease; VLNT = advanced disease
